title: `Scrt1.o: contains a compressed section, but zlib is not available` with `rust-lld`, `*-musl` toolchain & `-C target-feature=-crt-static`

labels.name: A-linkage
labels.description: Area: linking into static, shared libraries and binaries

labels.name: A-target-feature
labels.description: Area: Enabling/disabling target features like AVX, Neon, etc.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

Here's a minimal reproducible example:

```dockerfile
FROM rust:1.61-alpine

RUN mv $RUSTUP_HOME/toolchains/*/lib/rustlib/*/bin/rust-lld /bin/ld.lld
ENV RUSTFLAGS="-C target-feature=-crt-static -C link-arg=-fuse-ld=lld"
RUN set -eux; \
    cargo new hello; \
    cd hello; \
    cargo run

```

I expected it to build a docker image successfully.
Instead, this happened:

```
  = note: ld.lld: error: /usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-alpine-linux-musl/10.3.1/../../../../lib/Scrt1.o: contains a compressed section, but zlib is not available
          ld.lld: error: /usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-alpine-linux-musl/10.3.1/../../../../lib/Scrt1.o: contains a compressed section, but zlib is not available
          ld.lld: error: /usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-alpine-linux-musl/10.3.1/../../../../lib/Scrt1.o: contains a compressed section, but zlib is not available
          ld.lld: error: /usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-alpine-linux-musl/10.3.1/../../../../lib/Scrt1.o: contains a compressed section, but zlib is not available
          ld.lld: error: /usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-alpine-linux-musl/10.3.1/../../../../lib/Scrt1.o: contains a compressed section, but zlib is not available
          ld.lld: error: /usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-alpine-linux-musl/10.3.1/../../../../lib/crti.o: contains a compressed section, but zlib is not available
          ld.lld: error: /usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-alpine-linux-musl/10.3.1/../../../../lib/crti.o: contains a compressed section, but zlib is not available
          ld.lld: error: /usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-alpine-linux-musl/10.3.1/../../../../lib/crtn.o: contains a compressed section, but zlib is not available
          ld.lld: error: /usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-alpine-linux-musl/10.3.1/../../../../lib/crtn.o: contains a compressed section, but zlib is not available
          collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
```

For some reason, `rust-lld` and `librustc-driver-*.so` are statically linked on `musl` targets. I suspect this causes such an odd behavior.
I need `-C target-feature=-crt-static` to make `*-sys` correctly link dynamic libraries.
